sen.j: 葛城円（かつらぎのつぶら、生年不詳 - 安康天皇3年（456年））、紀元5世紀ごろに活躍した葛城氏の豪族。
sen.e: KATSURAGI no Tsubura (year of birth unknown - 456) was a member of the Katsuragi family, a local ruling family that had a big influence around 紀元5世紀the fifth century of the Christian era.
KATSURAGI no Tsubura (year of birth unknown - 456) was a member of local ruling family belonging to the Katsuragi clan that was active in around the fifth century A.D.
sen.cmt: 「紀元5世紀」の日本語表記は、特に必要ないので、削除しました。葛城氏→the Katsuragi clan紀元5世紀ごろに→in around the fifth century A.D.（"in"を挿入し、「紀元」を"A.D."に変更しました。）
sen.e: KATSURAGI no Tsubura (year of birth unknown - 456) was a member of local ruling family belonging to the Katsuragi clan that was active in around the fifth century A.D.

sen.j: 履中天皇2年（401年）、国政に参加する。
sen.e: In 401, he took part in the national politics.
In 401, he took part in the national politics.
In 401, he took part in the national politics.

sen.j: 安康天皇3年（456年）、眉輪王が安康天皇を殺した時、眉輪王と同時に疑いをかけられた坂合黒彦皇子（さかあいのくろひこのみこ）を屋敷にかくまう。
sen.e: In 456, when Prince Mayowa killed assassination of Emperor Ankoin, he harbored Prince Sakai no Kurohiko, who was suspected as a accomplice of Prince Mayowa
In 456, when Prince Mayowa killed the Emperor Anko, Tsubura sheltered Prince Sakai no Kurohiko in his residence, who was also suspected when Prince Mayowa was suspected.
sen.cmt: 安康天皇→Emperor Anko（誤記を訂正しました。）「同時に疑いをかけられる」＝「共犯者」とは断定できないので、"accomplice"を削除し、原文通りに英訳を変更しました。坂合黒彦皇子→Prince Sakai no Kuroniko（原文に、（さかあいのくろひこのみこ）と読み方が表記されておりますが、坂合黒彦皇子をインターネットで検索した結果（Wikipedia）、「さかいのくろひこのみこ」と表記されておりましたので、対訳及び初訳の表記のままとしました。）かくまう→shelter
sen.e: In 456, when Prince Mayowa killed the Emperor Anko, Tsubura sheltered Prince Sakai no Kurohiko in his residence, who was also suspected when Prince Mayowa was suspected.

sen.j: しかし、雄略天皇に屋敷を包囲され、娘の韓媛（からひめ）と葛城の屯倉（みやけ）7ヶ所を差出して許しを乞うたが、認められず焼き殺される。
sen.e: However, Emperor Yuryaku surrounded his residence, and although he asked for the Emperor's pardon, holding out his daughter Karahime and presenting seven miyake (Imperial-controlled territories) that he controlled in Katsuragi, but his pleading for life was not accepted and he was burned to death.

However, even though Tsubura whose residence was besieged by the Emperor Yuryaku requested the Emperor to forgive his act in exchange for presenting his daughter, Karahime, and seven of his miyake (Imperial-controlled territories) in Katsuragi, his request was not accepted and burned to death.
sen.cmt: 差出して→in exchange for presenting（「差出す代わりに」の意味なので、変更しました。）乞う→request（乞うた）が、→even though（「乞うたにもかかわらず」の意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: However, even though Tsubura whose residence was besieged by the Emperor Yuryaku requested the Emperor to forgive his act in exchange for presenting his daughter, Karahime, and seven of his miyake (Imperial-controlled territories) in Katsuragi, his request was not accepted and burned to death.
("Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan])
("Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan))
("Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan))

sen.j: 『古事記』では、坂合黒彦皇子は逃げこむ前に討たれ、差出した屯倉も5ヶ所になる。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Prince Sakai no Kurohiko was killed before running into his residence for refugee, and the number of the miyake he gave to the Emperor was five.
The "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) mentioned that Prince Sakai no Kurohiko was killed before fleeing into Tsubura's residence, and five of Tsubura's miyake were presented to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 逃げ込む→flee into（"run into"は「偶然出会う」「衝突する」の意味なので、変更しました。また、初訳では、"his residence"と表記しておりますが、これでは「坂合黒彦皇子の家に逃げ込む」の意味にも解釈できるので、"Tsubura's residence"に変更しました。）
sen.e: The "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) mentioned that Prince Sakai no Kurohiko was killed before fleeing into Tsubura's residence, and five of Tsubura's miyake were presented to the Emperor.

sen.j: また、焼き殺されたのではなく眉輪王を殺して自害したことになっている。
sen.e: In addition, he was not burned to death but he committed suicide after killing Prince Mayowa.
The "Kojiki" also mentioned that Tsubura was not burned to death but he committed suicide after killing Prince Mayowa.
sen.cmt: ～ことになっている→The "Kojiki" also mentioned that ～（前述の『古事記』の記述から続いているので、変更しました。）
sen.e: The "Kojiki" also mentioned that Tsubura was not burned to death but he committed suicide after killing Prince Mayowa.

sen.j: 曾祖父は武内宿禰、祖父は葛城襲津彦、父は玉田宿禰。
sen.e: His great-grandfather was TAKENOUCHI no sukune, his grandfather was KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, and his father was Tamada no sukune.
His great-grandfather was TAKENOUCHI no sukune, his grandfather was KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, and his father was Tamada no sukune.
His great-grandfather was TAKENOUCHI no sukune, his grandfather was KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, and his father was Tamada no sukune.

sen.e: His daughter was Karahime who became the wife of Emperor Yuryaku.
